title: Themis Reusable Rocket Takes Shape as ArianeGroup Completes Fit Check
summary:
ArianeGroup has brought the main elements of the Themis reusable booster demonstrator together for the first time during a “full-fit check.” This milestone paves the way for the demonstrator’s inaugural test, which is expected to take place in 2025. Themis is a 28-metre tall reusable rocket stage demonstrator developed by ArianeGroup under an ESA contract. […]
The post Themis Reusable Rocket Takes Shape as ArianeGroup Completes Fit Check appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ESA 2024 Highlights: flight of the Ariane 6
summary: In 2024, ESA continued to drive Europe’s innovation and excellence in space, equipping the continent with advanced tools and knowledge to address global and local challenges. The year saw pioneering missions, cutting-edge satellites and the pivotal restoration of Europe’s independent access to space.

title: Fit-check timelapse: Themis reusable rocket stage demonstrator
summary: In December 2024 the first Themis – Europe’s demonstrator of a reusable rocket first stage – completed a ‘full fit-check’ standing tall at ArianeGroup’s facility in Les Mureaux, France.

title: NASA endorses “continuous heartbeat” approach to human presence in LEO
summary:
NASA has endorsed the need to have humans in orbit continuously as it navigates the transition from the ISS to commercial stations.
The post NASA endorses “continuous heartbeat” approach to human presence in LEO appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Thailand signs Artemis Accords
summary:
Thailand signed the Artemis Accords Dec. 16, becoming the first nation to join both that document and a similar Chinese-led agreement.
The post Thailand signs Artemis Accords appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Fit for service: Themis reusable rocket stage demonstrator
“Continuous Heartbeat” Wins the Day in NASA’s LEO Microgravity Strategy
summary: NASA released its new Low Earth Orbit Microgravity Strategy today with goals and objectives for the post-International Space Station era. NASA has long held that the United States must have […]

title: U.S. Space Force launches expedited GPS mission using Falcon 9 rocket
summary: The U.S. Space Force’s Space Systems Command (SSC) and the Space Operations Command (SpOC) shifted the GPS 3 Space Vehicle 07 spacecraft to a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from a United Launch Alliance Vulcan rocket due to delays in Vulcan’s certification.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Starshield satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from California for the NRO
summary: The NROL-149 mission is scheduled to be the sixth and final mission of the year supporting the agency’s proliferated architecture. Liftoff from pad 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base is set for 5:19 a.m. PST (8:19 a.m. EST, 1319 UTC).

title: SpaceX launches U.S. Space Force ‘rapid response’ GPS mission
summary:
The mission named RRT-1 is the first “Rapid Response Trailblazer” launch designed to demonstrate U.S. capabilities to rapidly deploy national security satellites
